headline: High Promises, Low Deliveries
pros: High ownership of business, engaging coworkers, and availability to collaborate with people abroad in different positions and departments. Gained experience in Operations, Data Analytics, Product, Strategy, Government, and Marketing.
cons: Ever since accepting the offer recruitment back tracked on some aspects of initial offer (first red flag). At the end of the first work year HR changed the yearly bonus equation hence all employees recieved lower bonuses than expected (second red flag). Individual OKRs were vague and subjective, growing operations and unclear line of hierarchy led to vast work pile up. Internal professional growth opportunities were not equally distributed and seemed to not be based on meritocracy (third red flag).

headline: Typical Chinese Tech Giant w/Unhealthy Work Life Balance
pros:
- Learn a lot because there is a lot of responsibility and work to do
- Meet great, smart and talented people
- Get a strong brand on work resume
cons:
- Terrible work-life balance
- It has deep rooted Chinese tech company tendencies (primarily chinese speaking, hierarchical, need to prove loyalty before any advancements, top-down decision making, no visibility into how things are done from lower levels)
- Horrible pay because there is a line out the door of applicants
- Very high turnover

headline: DiDi is a company where you can grow and develop with a bright team of motivated professionals
pros:
- The staff they hire go through a number of interviews to make sure they fit in properly. 
- The pay is competitive. 
- DiDi is a start-up, so there are a lot of things to do both within and outside of your career track. You'll never get bored!
cons:
- Because teams are numerous, it may take you a while to get used to processes. 
- You need to work your way up. Although leaders and line managers are supportive, they don't pull you, and you need to look for growth opportunities on your own.

headline: Great place to work (MKT area)
pros:
- Good management (but can improve) 
- Good team work 
- Work life balance 
- Clear growing path 
- Good salary and great benefits 

In general you learn a lot, everyone is good in their area, and overall theres a good work environment. Leaders really try to share their vision and push towards achieving business goals and inspire everyone to be excellent at what they do. There's a lot of space to try new things, test them and evaluate what works best for the company and the brand. There's room for creativity and leaders and managers are always open to hear your opinion.
cons:
- Disorganisation: The work flow between areas can be a little messy and sometimes create conflict 

- Management: Eve though it's not bad, a manager selection should cover the basics so that his/her team feels oriented, has visibility of the goals of the team and his/her self and helps them grow within the company

- Growth: you CAN grow, but it takes time and a lot , a lot of preparation and har work

- MKT team goals & structure: I don't really think the teams structure and way of work is a disadvantage, but, if you are NOT looking to work in an in-house creative agency kind of team, then DiDi is not your thing.

headline: Ever lasting learning and professional environment
pros:
I really appreciate the confidence and ownership placed in each team member, it let’s you speak your mind and feel involved in the decision making towards achieving the brands goals. Also, people are respectful, everyone is willingly helping each other towards a better understanding of each functional area of the business. 

A lot of processes are still on the go, but everyone works very hard to create the best workflows and processes to deliver the best expectations possible.
cons:
It’s a highly competitive company, but if you have this type of attitude I think it can be very fulfilling. 

Everyone is workaholic, which can also be a fit for you if you are willing to spend more than 12 hours nonstop.

pros:
Great industry to learn about
Generally nice people to work with (many smart people who unfortunately are overqualified for their positions)
Great work/life balance
cons:
Terrible HR - huge power struggle within the team which leads them to be extremely unresponsive to any real issues for employees
Organizational politics with only 6 people having a defined career track (top talents have been leaving every 2-3 weeks over the past 3-4 months)
Spineless and incompetent upper management (except for 1-2 people)
Seems that you have to be Chinese and male to head any meaningful position at the company
Terrible finance and reimbursement policies make it extremely hard to get your corporate costs expensed

headline: Toxic Environment
pros: Fast paced company and diverse environment
cons:
The working environment is toxic, a lot of political and subjective decisions. The evaluation is not in the performance, is in how good is your relationship with some Chinese stakeholders. 
The Chinese leadership trusts blindly some people, which makes them really closed minded about other's opinions, they just see what their eyes want to see.

The overall environmental welfare of the company is good.

headline: Lacks focus on people
pros: Exciting company to work for, can learn alot about growth and business
cons:
Cannot echo this enough, there is an extremely high amount of political game playing. Many people progress despite not outputting work and plot the downfall of their peers. 

People will actively block eachother and sabotage.

Despite focus on KPIs, KPIs are moving targets.

No focus on people, quick to replace everyone quickly and without concern

headline: Exciting but messy place to work
pros:
Fast-paced exciting company to work for.
Great atmosphere among the staff, majority are idealist, future focussed and work hard to accomplish company goals. 
Staff are very well rewarded for their contribution.
Leaders are wonderful people.
cons:
An overwhelming focus on profit and growth at the cost of ethics.
High amount of political game playing.
Constant change in requirements and micro-managing and indecisive leadership.
